intro: Phoradendron antillarum var. orientale, commonly known as the coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is typically a shrub or small tree, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and elliptic in shape, while its bark is smooth and reddish in color. The coral tree is also known for its ability to thrive in saline environments, making it a common sight in coastal landscapes.
